content.div:
Gripe about awards shows all you like: they're long, they're boring, they don't involve nearly enough Victoria's Secret models and/or touchdowns. We still watch them, though -- and, speaking for ourselves, anyway, it's because they're all about live TV. Nobody knows who's going to win the Grammy Awards -- or, potentially, pants Kanye West in the middle of an acceptance speech.

Still, we'd place some bets on six-time nominee Adele.

We're not making wagers on her chances of winning. (Sure, she's a universally beloved songstress with the highest-selling album and single of 2011. But did you watch the show last year? As the Arcade Fire taught us, Grammy night is all about surprises.)

Rather, we're betting the 21 hitmaker will be in top form for her Grammy performance -- her first public appearance since undergoing vocal cord surgery in November.

60 Minutes has the compelling evidence. Their interview with the singer will run before music's big night, and in a preview clip, Adele sings her hit "Rolling in the Deep" for the program, proving the "voice of her generation" has not been lost.

Watch it below. And check back to Dose.ca Sunday, Feb. 12 for more Grammy coverage, including our live-tweet of the night's events.

leahc@dose.ca

entry.title: Karl Lagerfeld 'Sorry' For Calling Adele Fat

link.Abstract: Chanel creative director Karl Lagerfeld issued an official statement apologizing for calling Grammy nominee Adele "a little too fat."
link.title: [ more ]

link.Abstract: Karl Lagerfeld called Grammy nominee Adele "a little too fat," and he's now eating his words. (Anyone know the calorie count for that phrase?)
link.title: Karl Lagerfeld

link.Abstract: Earlier this week, an old man with a heavily starched collar and powdered hair was interviewed about the headlines of the day by a free daily commuter paper. Among other things, he said that Greeks and Italians have disgusting habits, and that Russian men are ugly. He also said that while British singer Adele "has a beautiful face and a divine voice," she's "a little too fat."
link.title: Nathalie Atkinson on Karl Lagerfeld's Fat Flap

link.title: Hedley talks about growing up

link.title: Photos: Drake Takes Care of Las Vegas

link.title: Photos: 2011 BRIT Awards

link.Abstract: The VMAs are about fun -- the sort of fun that, this year at least, involves drag and distended wombs and at least a little swapping of spit. Here are a few of Sunday night’s best (and worst) examples.
link.title: Best and Worst Moments at the 2011 MTV VMAs

link.Abstract: Florence + The Machine, Kelly Clarkson, Jennifer Hudson, Jessie J, Mary J. Blige and more "celebrated soul" during the VH1 Divas special Dec. 18 in New York. We've got pictures.
link.title: Photos: Florence + The Machine, Kelly Clarkson and More are VH1 Divas

link.Abstract: Harry Potter's Rupert Grint stars in a new video from English singer-songwriter Ed Sheeran. It's called "Lego House." Watch it here.
link.title: Harry Potter Star Rupert Grint's Latest Role? This Music Video

link.Abstract: Florence + The Machine covered Drake's "Take Care" during an appearance at BBC 1's Live Lounge. Hear it here.
link.title: Video: Florence + The Machine Take On Drake's 'Take Care'

link.Abstract: We're thrilled Chris Martin never made good on his promise to retire at 33. Here's why.
link.title: 10 Reasons To Be a Coldplay Fan

link.Abstract: Noel Gallagher took the stage in Toronto Nov. 7 for his first North American show as Noel Gallagher's High Flying Birds -- or, rather, his first North American show not as a member of Oasis. Dose.ca was there.
link.title: Concert Review: Noel Gallagher's High Flying Birds at Massey Hall

link.Abstract: Run, Florence, run! There's a supernatural hit on Florence + The Machine in new video "No Light, No Light." Watch it here.
link.title: Video: Florence + The Machine Dabble in Dark Arts For 'No Light, No Light' Clip

link.title: [ more ]

link.title: Kanye West

link.Abstract: Consider it a sample of what you can expect on Grammy night, Feb. 12, 2012. The Grammy Nominations Concert took place Nov. 30, 2011 at L.A.'s Nokia Theatre. We've got photos from the event.
link.title: Photos: Inside the Grammy Nominations Concert

link.Abstract: From Taylor Swift's big win to Justin Bieber in Zubaz pants, we're looking back at the most memorable moments of the evening.
link.title: Best and Worst Moments from the AMAs

link.Abstract: Montreal was watching Kanye West and Jay-Z Nov. 22 when the two MCs brought their Watch the Throne tour to the Bell Centre. We've got photos. The Watch the Throne tour continues to Vancouver Dec. 17 and 18.
link.title: Photos: Watch The Throne in Montreal

link.Abstract: Taylor Swift's Speak Now World Tour is at its end. The country-pop star gave the first of two sold-out shows at New York's Madison Square Garden Nov. 21. We've got photos.
link.title: Photos: Taylor Swift at Madison Square Garden

link.Abstract: Selena Gomez! Lady Gaga! Coldplay! A dancing leprechaun! (Oops! That was actually Justin Bieber!) We've got pictures from the 2011 MTV Europe Music Awards, held Nov. 6 in Belfast, Ireland.
link.title: Photos: Inside the 2011 MTV Europe Music Awards

link.Abstract: Lady Gaga vows to channel her inner "Indian hippie" at a press conference in New Delhi.
link.title: Gallery: Lady Gaga in India

link.Abstract: Nicki Minaj is more than just a pretty face. She's also an angry face, a bonkers face ... we could go on. Here are some of the best examples from the MC's new video for "Till the World Ends."
link.title: Gallery: The Many Faces of Nicki Minaj

link.Abstract: Nip-slips, a turkey dinner and more nip-slips. That's how you celebrate Pink Friday! Nicki Minaj's Friday, Aug. 5 performance on Good Morning America was packed with surprises.
link.title: Photos: Nicki Minaj Does Good Morning America

link.Abstract: What happens in Vegas stays in Vegas...but we managed to smuggle out these photos. See pics of Nicki Minaj at the I Heart Radio music festival Sept. 24.
link.title: Photos: Nicki Minaj Plays I Heart Radio Fest

link.Abstract: Lady Gaga made out with Sting, did pilates on a motorcycle/keyboard and danced in her underwear. What happens in Vegas stays in Vegas...but we managed to smuggle out these photos. See pics of Gaga's Sept. 24 set at the I Heart Radio music festival.
link.title: Photos: Lady Gaga Plays I Heart Radio Fest
